intro: Dissotis dichaetantheroides, commonly known as the narrow-awned dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, two-lobed flowers that are typically greenish or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
